# Grids

Grids in the pattern library are responsive, cross platform and comprised of a few props on the Box component.

The easiest way to envision laying out this grid is by assuming the entire screen is 12 _(invisible)_ columns wide, on `small` screens we set the `Box` `small` prop to `{12}` to make it full width, on `medium` screens, we set to `{8}` for the column on the left and `{4}` on the right, this is `12` in total filling our screen width. On `large` screens and above, we set both to `{6}` to create equal width columns.

> The swap from row to column on small screens happens in JavaScript userland. It happens automatically once the breakpoint for small screens is hit.

The above documentation creates the following layouts.

## Example

The above example (in text) is shown below as real world code.

```typescript

const MyGrid = () => (
	<Box grid>
		<Box column small={12} medium={8} large={6}>
			<Box row>
				<Text>Grids with Flexbox!</Text>
				<Text>I&apos;m on the left on everything but on top on Mobile!</Text>
			</Box>
		</Box>
		<Box column small={12} medium={4} large={6}>
			<Box row>
				<Text>Grids with Flexbox!</Text>
				<Text>
					I&apos;m on the right on everything but on bottom on Mobile!
				</Text>
			</Box>
		</Box>
	</Box>
)
```
